def.dt: :very bright :flashing with light brilliant jewels a brilliant star in the sky a store decorated in brilliant colors
:very impressive or successful He pitched a brilliant game. She gave a brilliant performance. a brilliant career
:extremely intelligent :much more intelligent than most people a brilliant scientist She has a brilliant mind.
:showing extreme intelligence :extremely clever a brilliant idea often used in a joking or ironic way to describe a foolish idea, action, etc. It was brilliant of you to leave your passport at home!
:very good :wonderful or excellent Dinner was brilliant. It is a brilliant [=fabulous] film. You really must see it. We had a brilliant time at the circus.

utxt.vi: She acted brilliantly in her first film.
